tool_description: QuantiModo will automatically aggregate life-tracking data from your users apps and devices with a single API.  It can then analyze this data allowing you to provide your users with actionable insights they can use to optimize their lives.
name: QuantiModo
title: QuantiModo

api_list.name: Store / Update Measurements
api_list.description: Post a new set or update existing measurements to the database
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com/measurements/v2"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com/measurements/v2"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Add a data source
api_list.description: Add a life-tracking app or device to the QuantiModo list of data sources.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com/measurementSources"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Create Variables
api_list.description: Allows the client to create a new variable in the variables table.

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Store or Update a Correlation
Votes
api_list.description: This is to enable users to indicate their opinion on the plausibility of a causal relationship between a treatment and outcome. QuantiModo incorporates crowd-sourced plausibility estimations into their algorithm. This is done allowing user to indicate their view of the plausibility of each relationship with thumbs up/down buttons placed next to each prediction.

api_list.name: Update User Settings for a Variable
api_list.description: Users can change things like the display name for a variable.  They can also change the parameters used in analysis of that variable such as the expected duration of action for a variable to have an effect, the estimated delay before the onset of action.  In order to filter out erroneous data, they are able to set the maximum and minimum reasonable daily values for a variable.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com/variableUserSettings"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
